text: Indirana longicrus is a species of frog found in the Western Ghats of India. It is only known from its type locality, Kempholey, Karnataka. The habitat preferences of this species are not known, although it is possibly a forest species that presumably breeds like other members of the genus, with larvae being found on wet rocks next to streams. ==Major threats== The area where it was collected, and might possibly still occur, is threatened by clearance for agricultural use. ==References== longicrus Category:Frogs of India Category:Endemic fauna of the Western Ghats Category:Taxa named by C. R. Narayan Rao Category:Amphibians described in 1937
title: Indirana longicrus
